entry.title: Krispy Kreme Introduces New Harry Potter Donuts with One for Each Hogwarts House
entry.summary:
Krispy Kreme partners with Warner Bros. Discovery Global Consumer Products to introduce the new Harry Potter: Houses of Hogwarts x Krispy Kreme Collection, which includes a themed donut for each Hogwarts House. There's also a special Sorting Hat Donut.
The donuts are available for a limited time starting Monday, August 18, 2025, at participating locations across the country. Here's what you can expect to find:
Gryffindor Donut - A shell donut filled with cookie butter-flavored Kreme, dipped in red icing and Biscoff cookie crumble, topped with golden icing drizzles and a Gryffindor crest. Slytherin Donut - An Original Glazed donut topped with chocolate and green buttercreme-flavored swirls, a chocolate cookie sugar blend, and a Slytherin crest. entry.title: Taco Bell Launches New Mountain Dew Baja Midnight
entry.summary:
Taco Bell launches new Mountain Dew Baja Midnight as a permanent addition to its soda fountain.
The new, Taco Bell-exclusive soda flavor is purple with the taste of passion fruit mixed with the Mountain Dew Baja Blast (which is Mountain Dew plus tropical lime flavor). Like Mountain Dew Baja Blast, Mountain Dew Baja Midnight is available as a slush ice Freeze. The suggested price for Mountain Dew Baja Midnight is $2.49 for a small, $2.79 for a medium, and $2.99 for a large. The Mountain Dew Baja Midnight Freeze has a suggested price of $3.79 for a regular and $3.99 for a large. Like the fast-food chain's other Freeze and sodas, you can get a regular Freeze or a medium soda for $1 during Happier Hour, from 2 to 5PM, at participating locations. On August 15, 2025, rewards members can get a free medium Mountain Dew Baja Midnight when spending $5 or more through the Taco Bell mobile app. Photo via Taco Bell. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: New Little Debbie Pumpkin Spice Oatmeal Creme Pies Arrive as Part of Fall 2025 Lineup
entry.summary:
Little Debbie launches a new Pumpkin Spice Oatmeal Creme Pie as part of this year's fall product lineup.
A seasonal take on the brand's classic Oatmeal Creme Pie, the pumpkin spice rendition features two soft oatmeal cookies sandwiching a layer of pumpkin spice-flavored orange creme. A box of eight carries a suggested price of $3.19. Other new products from Little Debbie for fall 2025 include:
Fall Mini Muffins - Buttery, bite-sized vanilla muffins baked with yellow, brown, and orange inclusions. A box of 5 pouches costs $3.19 (may vary) Fall Gingerbread Cookies - Soft gingerbread cookies with a sugary crunch. They come 8 cookies to a carton for a suggested price of $3.19. Club Pack Brownie Pumpkins - A 20-count Club Pack of Little Debbie Brownie Pumpkins for a suggested price of $12.75.
Other fall products back for the season include:
Apple Cinnamon Donut Sticks Brownie Pumpkins (box of five) Fall Party Cakes Chocolate Fall Party Cakes Fall Gingerbread Cookies Pumpkin Delights Pumpkin Spice Minit Donuts Pumpkin Spice Rolls Football Brownies (available through February 2026)
Little Debbie's fall snacks are now available at retailers nationwide for a limited time through late October 2025, while supplies last. Photo via Little Debbie. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Culver's Debuts New Cereal Concrete Mixers
entry.summary:
Culver's partners with General Mills to launch a trio of new Cereal Concrete Mixers featuring three classic cereal brands.
Available for a limited time, the Cereal Concrete Mixers lineup includes:
Cocoa Puffs Concrete Mixer - Chocolaty cereal puffs mixed with chocolate or vanilla frozen custard. Lucky Charms Concrete Mixer - Frosted oat cereal and colorful marshmallows mixed into vanilla or chocolate frozen custard. Cinnamon Toast Crunch Concrete Mixer - Cinnamon Toast Crunch blended into vanilla or chocolate frozen custard.
To encourage customers to try all three flavors, Culver's is offering Cereal Concrete Mixer Flights, a dine-in option that includes three mini Concrete Mixers (one of each flavor) for the price of two. Photo via Culver's. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: 40% Off Footlong Subs at Subway
entry.summary:
Subway is offering an exclusive 40% discount on Footlong subs online for a limited time to its rewards members.
The deal is available when ordering through the Subway website or mobile app using the code "FORTY". The 40% off deal follows a buy-one-get-one-for-50% off deal that recently finished its run. It is available through September 8, 2025, at participating locations nationwide. Subway also continues to offer its $6.99 Meal of the Day, which includes a 6" sub of the day (it changes each day of the week), a drink, and chips or two cookies. Photo via Subway. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: P.F. Chang's Introduces New Freakier Friday Menu
entry.summary:
P.F. Chang's welcomes its new "Freakier Flavors" menu inspired by Disney's recently released Freakier Friday movie. Interestingly enough, the original Freaky Friday included a fictional House of Chiang restaurant (which sounds similar to P.F. Chang's), which the new menu pays tribute to.
P.F. Chang's new Freakier Friday-themed menu includes:
House of Chang's Spicy Chicken Dinner Special - Chang's Spicy Chicken served with white rice and an egg roll. Mix It Up Mongolian Beef Dinner Special - Mongolian Beef served with white rice or lo mein and a house salad. Switcheroo Refresher - Mango-orange lemonade that changes color and shimmers. Crystal Ball Refresher - A mix of desert pear, lemonade, Sprite, and club soda that changes color and shimmers. Pink Slip Ube Cheesecake - Vanilla cheesecake base topped with a creamy, nutty ube layer, made from purple sweet potato (ube), and topped with edible pink glitter.
The Freakier Flavors menu is available now for a limited time at most P.F. Chang's locations nationwide through September 2, 2025. Photo via P.F. Chang's. Read more at Brand Eating!

entry.title: Little Caesars Offers Large Two-Topping Crazy Crust Pizza for $6.99
entry.summary:
Little Caesars is offering a limited-time, online-only deal where you can get a large, two-topping Crazy Crust Pizza for $6.99.
The deal can be redeemed by using the promo code "JUSTCRUSTUS" when ordering through the Little Caesars website or mobile app at participating locations nationwide (except Alaska and Hawaii). Little Caesars' Crazy Crust is the chain's regular crust brushed at the edge with a buttery-flavored garlic spread and sprinkled with Parmesan (in the same manner as the chain's Crazy Bread). A large, two-topping Crazy Crust Pizza is normally $11.99 at my local Little Caesars restaurant in Los Angeles. Photo via Little Caesars. Read more at Brand Eating!
